intro: Trigonostemon, commonly known as the three-angled leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive tri-lobed leaves, which give it its common name. The plants typically have smooth, waxy leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Trigonostemon species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
